title: Liran Cohen
text:
Liran Cohen (; born 14 February 1983 in <a href="Rishon%20LeZion">Rishon LeZion</a>) is an Israeli <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player who plays for <a href="A.S.%20HaMakhtesh%20Giv%27atayim">A.S. HaMakhtesh Giv'atayim</a>.
Career.
Club.
He previously played for <a href="Maccabi%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Maccabi Tel Aviv</a>, <a href="Maccabi%20Petah%20Tikva%20F.C.">Maccabi Petah Tikva</a> and <a href="Bnei%20Yehuda%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Bnei Yehuda</a>.
A former key player for <a href="Maccabi%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Maccabi Tel Aviv</a>, and despite his lack of experience in Europe he has scored several important goals for Maccabi in their last campaigns in the <a href="UEFA%20Cup">UEFA Cup</a> and in the <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a>.
In August 2011, he was loaned to <a href="Podbeskidzie%20Bielsko-Bia%C5%82a">Podbeskidzie Bielsko-Biała</a> on a half-year deal.
In January 2013, Cohen signed at <a href="Hapoel%20Haifa%20F.C.">Hapoel Haifa</a>.
International.
At international level, Cohen was <a href="cap%20%28sport%29">capped</a> for the <a href="Israel%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Israel national under-21 football team</a>.
